title: Empirical Rule
question_text:
The random variable $X$ is normally distributed with a mean of $10$ and a standard deviation of $1.5$.
Approximately $84\%$ of the observations of this data set are greater than
solution:
According to the empirical rule, since the data is approximately normal, about $68\%$ of the data lies within one standard deviation. Therefore, $16\%$ of the data is more than one standard deviation below the mean, and $16\%$ of the data is more than one standard deviation above the mean:

$$68\%+16\% = 84\%$$

$84\%$ of the data will be greater than one standard deviation below the mean.

We can find this value by taking the mean and subtracting one standard deviation:

$$=10-1.5$$

$$=8.5$$

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'A'.
